marketNews.title: Coal Production Has Exceeded Government Target
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources noted that national coal production reached 711.37 million tons as of November 15, 2024, already exceeding the 2024 target set by the government, which aimed for 710 million tons. The 2024 production target itself is 2.2% higher than the 2023 target of 695 million tons. The Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, predicted that national coal production throughout 2024 will be around 800 million tons, 3.2% higher compared to the 2023 realization of 775 million tons. Out of the national coal production as of November 15, 2024, as much as 50.6% or 359 million tons were sold to export markets, equivalent to 69.3% of the 2023 export realization. The strong national coal production up to mid-November 2024 is also reflected in the production volume of coal producer issuers during 9M24. The details are as follows: ADRO: 55.6 million tons (+9.5% YoY); ITMG: 15 million tons (+11.1% YoY); PTBA: 33 million tons (+3.4% YoY); BUMI (as of 1H24): 37.7 million tons (+7% YoY). Key Takeaway: Solid coal production potentially indicates a positive signal for coal supporting issuers such as UNTR and DOID (mining contractors) and TPMA (coal logistics). On the other hand, the strong coal production in Indonesia potentially has a negative impact on coal prices if not balanced by demand, especially considering the risk of China's still weak economy, which is the target of tariffs from the US President-elect, Donald Trump.

marketNews.title: US Blocks Ceasefire Resolution in UNSC
marketNews.content: The US blocked a draft resolution for a ceasefire in the Palestine-Israel conflict at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday (20/11). This move marked the 4th time the US used its veto power during the conflict to protect its ally, Israel.

marketNews.title: Bitcoin Price Hits All-Time High Amid Pro-Crypto Sentiment Linked to Donald Trump
marketNews.content: The price of Bitcoin broke the 97,000 US dollar level for the first time on Thursday (21/11) and touched 97,862 US dollars, marking an all-time high. The strengthening of the Bitcoin price in recent weeks has been influenced by positive market sentiment regarding Donald Trump's victory in the US election, where he promised pro-crypto measures if he took office.

marketNews.title: Analysts See Slower, Shallower Rate Cuts Likely in Indonesia Due to Global Uncertainty
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that analysts see Bank Indonesia likely carrying out slower and fewer reference interest rate cuts due to global uncertainty endangering the stability of the Rupiah. Most analysts predict Bank Indonesia will take a longer pause on rate cuts due to geopolitical tensions and the prospect of protectionist policies from the Donald Trump administration, which risks delaying Fed rate easing and spurring investor demand for safe-haven assets like the US dollar. Bloomberg mentioned that some analysts still expect Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate in December 2024, but most analysts anticipate Bank Indonesia will wait until 2025 to resume rate cuts. Furthermore, Bloomberg Economics does not rule out the possibility that Bank Indonesia could reverse course and raise interest rates within the next 12 months if financial market volatility worsens.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Assess $100 Million Apple Bid to End iPhone 16 Ban
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Industry Spokesperson, Febri Hendri Antoni Arif, stated that the ministry has received an investment proposal valued at 100 million US dollars from Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL). Febri mentioned that if this investment materializes, Apple will obtain a Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate, allowing the iPhone 16 series to be officially sold in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Confident Indonesia Can Achieve Net Zero Emissions Before 2050, Plans to Halt Coal Power Plants Faster
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto stated that he is optimistic Indonesia can achieve net zero emissions before 2050, one decade earlier than the previous target. President Prabowo also mentioned that Indonesia plans to halt all coal-fired and fossil fuel power plants within the next 15 years, faster than the previous target of 2056. Furthermore, President Prabowo stated that Indonesia will build renewable power plants with a total capacity of 75 GW in the next 15 years. Reuters noted that Indonesia's electricity capacity currently reaches over 90 GW, but new and renewable energy only contributes less than 15% of that amount.

marketNews.title: PHRI Projects Hotel Occupancy to Drop -10% YoY During Christmas and New Year Holidays
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Hotel and Restaurant Association, Hariyadi Sukamdani, projected that hotel occupancy rates during the Christmas and New Year (Nataru) 2025 holiday period will decrease by -10% Year-over-Year (YoY). Hariyadi mentioned that this projection is based on slower hotel bookings compared to last year. Haryadi stated that weak public purchasing power is one of the causes for this occupancy decline.

tickerNews.title: SMRA 9M24 Net Profit +43% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded a net profit of IDR 180 billion (-15% YoY, -42% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result was pressured by a decline in revenue (-10% YoY, -47% QoQ), mostly from a decrease in revenue recognition from the development segment (-26% YoY, -61% QoQ) following a drop in the housing sub-segment (-39% YoY, -67% QoQ). Note that the quarterly performance of a property issuer may increase or decrease sharply, depending on revenue recognition. Meanwhile, net profit during 9M24 reached IDR 934 billion (+43% YoY), equivalent to 87% of the consensus FY24F estimate. SMRA recorded strong revenue recognition growth during 9M24 (+49% YoY), as well as gross profit margin expansion (+240 bps YoY) and operating profit margin expansion (+630 bps YoY). This led to operating profit during 9M24 reaching IDR 2.8 trillion (+80% YoY), having surpassed the consensus FY24F estimate of IDR 2.4 trillion.

tickerNews.title: UNTR revises Komatsu sales guidance down slightly, raises coal production guidance up
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors stated in an analyst meeting on Thursday (21/11) that the company revised down its guidance for Komatsu brand heavy equipment sales in 2024 from 4,500 units to 4,350 units due to shipping delays. Previously, UNTR in September 2024 had revised up its Komatsu sales guidance for 2024 from 4,000 units to 4,500 units. Meanwhile, the coal production guidance for 2024 was revised up from 144 million tons to 147 million tons. For 2025, UNTR provided guidance for Komatsu brand heavy equipment sales of 4,600 units (+5.7% YoY), coal production of 150 million tons (+2% YoY), overburden volume of 1.25 billion bcm (+2% YoY), coal sales of 14 million tons (+6.1% YoY), gold sales of 240,000 ounces (+2.1% YoY), and nickel ore sales of 2 million tons (+5.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTPP signs agreement to sell telecommunications infrastructure subsidiary, part of IDR 1 Trillion divestment plan
tickerNews.content: PTPP: The President Director of PT PP, Novel Arsyad, stated that his party has signed a sale agreement for PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi - a PTPP subsidiary in the telecommunications infrastructure sector, specifically fiber optic - to a telecommunications company in Indonesia. Novel did not detail the transaction value or the identity of the buyer, but said the transaction is likely to be completed in December 2024. This transaction is part of PTPP's plan to divest assets up to IDR 1 trillion during 2024, aimed at reducing the company's long-term debt which reached IDR 11.31 trillion as of 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: INDY targets 50% non-coal business contribution by 2028, Awak Mas gold mine projected to start production in 2H26
tickerNews.content: INDY: The Deputy President Director of Indika Energy, Azis Armand, stated that his party is targeting a contribution from non-coal businesses to reach 50% of the company's total revenue by 2028, a 3-year delay compared to the previous target of 2025. Azis explained that the revision of this target takes into account the performance of the company's non-coal subsidiaries, most of which have not yet generated revenue. Moving forward, Azis mentioned that gold mining and logistics port infrastructure will be the cornerstones of the company's business. INDY itself is targeting the Awak Mas gold mining project managed by its subsidiary to start production in 2H26 with an output of 100,000 ounces per year.

tickerNews.title: DSSA plans IDR 2.5 Trillion bond and IDR 959 Billion sukuk issuance with mixed tenors and ratings
tickerNews.content: DSSA: Dian Swastatika Sentosa plans to issue bonds worth IDR 2.5 trillion and sukuk worth IDR 959 billion. The proceeds from the bond and sukuk issuance are intended for refinancing, data center development, homepass network development, and geothermal power plant (PLTP) construction. The bonds and sukuk each consist of 3 series (tenors of 370 days, 3 years, and 5 years) with interest/profit-sharing rates of 6.5%, 8.125%, and 8.625% respectively. The bonds and sukuk have received an idAA and idAA(sy) rating from Pefindo, respectively. The public offering schedule is set for November 21, 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Cement Sales Volume in October 2024 Down -3% YoY, 10M24 Volume Down -4% YoY
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded cement sales volume of 3.8 million tons (-3% YoY, +14% MoM) in October 2024, which was lower than the industry-wide cement sales decline (excluding Semen Grobogan) of -2.6% YoY. This result caused SMGR's cement sales volume for 10M24 to drop to 31.7 million tons (-4% YoY). The annual volume decline in October 2024 was caused by a decrease in sales from Indonesian facilities to 3.7 million tons (-2% YoY, +14% MoM), followed by a decrease in sales from Vietnamese facilities to 88.6 thousand tons (-16% YoY, +32% MoM) due to exports remaining halted. From a segmentation perspective, the share of bag cement sales in October 2024 reached 69.8% of total sales (vs. September 2024: 69.9%).

tickerNews.title: SGER secures 500,000 tons coal supply contract with Vietnamese company
tickerNews.content: SGER: Sumber Global Energy secured a coal sales contract of 500,000 tons with a Vietnamese company, Power Generation Corporation. The transaction value has not been announced, while delivery will occur 6 months from the contract signing date. In this transaction, SGER will supply coal with a net calorific value of 4,600 kcal/kg.

tickerNews.title: PPRI Directors Sell a Total of 30 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The Directors of Paperocks Indonesia (PPRI), Catur Jatiwaluyo and Dillon Sutandar, each sold 15 million PPRI shares at a price of IDR 105 per share and IDR 106 per share, respectively. The total transaction value reached IDR 1.6 billion each. After these transactions, Catur Jatiwaluyo's ownership in PPRI decreased from 18.6% to 17.21%, while Dillon Sutandar's ownership decreased from 26.05% to 24.65%.
